intro: Baloghia montana var. neohebridensis, commonly known as the New Hebrides baloghia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal or disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
